intro: Cryptantha torreyana var. calistogae, commonly known as the Calistoga cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of California. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils. This variety is considered rare and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure.
